agenda.description: ** REVISION ** HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Juvenile Justice & Family Issues TIME & DATE: 10:30 AM or upon final adjourn./recess or bill referral if permission granted Wednesday, May 1, 2019 PLACE: E2.012 CHAIR: Rep. Harold V. Dutton, Jr. HB 758 Wu Relating to public access to juvenile court proceedings. HB 922 Krause Relating to a divorce on the ground of insupportability. HB 926 Krause Relating to the waiting period for a divorce on the grounds of insupportability. HB 2061 Burns Relating to the authority to issue an arrest warrant or citation for certain Class C misdemeanors committed by certain children on school property. HB 2109 Flynn | et al. Relating to the right of recusal from the performance of certain marriage ceremonies. HB 2209 Meyer Relating to an affirmative defense to an allegation of truant conduct. HB 2767 Martinez Fischer Relating to the delivery of a recorded marriage license by e-mail. HB 3145 Toth Relating to the right of a parent appointed as a conservator of a child to attend school activities. HB 3461 Wu Relating to allowing TJJD to approve a small number of Regional Diversion Alternatives placements for youth with intense needs at a higher rate than the average daily cost of state secure facilities. HB 3595 Sanford Relating to the modification of an order establishing the conservatorship or possession of or access to a child after a conservator's death. HB 3761 Miller Relating to the rendition of certain temporary orders in a suit affecting the parent-child relationship in anticipation of a parent's military deployment, military mobilization, or temporary military duty. HB 4038 Dominguez Relating to an affirmative defense to certain prohibited sexual conduct occurring as part of a dating relationship that began in primary or secondary school. HB 4665 Leman Relating to the juvenile board of Fayette County. Bills deleted after last posting: HB 1871 HB 3841 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions ** of the schedule, if applicable. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
